# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/linux-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/platformdirs/api.py
@source-hash: 40161d51a736782e
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:00:40Z

## Purpose

Defines the abstract base class for platform directory APIs providing cross-platform access to standard system directories (data, config, cache, etc.) with configurable application-specific path construction.

## Key Components

**PlatformDirsABC (L14-292)** - Abstract base class defining the platform directories interface
- **Constructor (L17-78)** - Configures application metadata and path behavior:
  - `appname`: Application identifier for path construction
  - `appauthor`: Distributing organization name  
  - `version`: Optional version suffix for paths
  - `roaming`: Windows roaming profile support flag
  - `multipath`: Return all directories vs first only
  - `opinion`: Use opinionated path defaults
  - `ensure_exists`: Auto-create directories on access

**Path Construction Utilities**
- **_append_app_name_and_version (L80-88)** - Builds paths with app name/version suffixes
- **_optionally_create_directory (L90-92)** - Creates directories if ensure_exists=True

**Abstract Directory Properties (L94-172)** - Must be implemented by subclasses:
- User-scoped: `user_data_dir`, `user_config_dir`, `user_cache_dir`, `user_state_dir`, `user_log_dir`
- System-scoped: `site_data_dir`, `site_config_dir`, `site_cache_dir`  
- Special directories: `user_documents_dir`, `user_downloads_dir`, `user_pictures_dir`, `user_videos_dir`, `user_music_dir`, `user_desktop_dir`
- Runtime directories: `user_runtime_dir`, `site_runtime_dir`

**Path Object Wrappers (L174-252)** - Concrete properties returning pathlib.Path objects for all directory types

**Iterator Methods (L254-292)** - Yield collections of related directories:
- `iter_config_dirs/paths`: User and site config directories
- `iter_data_dirs/paths`: User and site data directories  
- `iter_cache_dirs/paths`: User and site cache directories
- `iter_runtime_dirs/paths`: User and site runtime directories

## Dependencies

- `os`: Path joining operations
- `abc`: Abstract base class framework
- `pathlib.Path`: Modern path object handling
- `typing`: Type hints for Iterator and Literal

## Architecture Notes

- Template method pattern: Base class provides path construction logic, subclasses implement platform-specific directory resolution
- Dual API: Both string paths and Path objects supported
- Lazy directory creation: Only creates directories when ensure_exists=True and path is accessed
- Configurable path composition: App name and version automatically appended to base paths when provided
